this list. Even

interesting, a
topic of the week might help us stay a little more on
track as far as
discussing homeschooling and unschooling issues. Any

Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] NEW TOPIC
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/2/01 12:57:06 PM, cdefrancisco@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/2/01 12:57:06 PM, cdefrancisco@... writes:

<< Even
though the our "off topic" tangents tend to be quite interesting, a
topic of the week might help us stay a little more on track as far as
discussing homeschooling and unschooling issues. Any thoughts? >>

Sounds like unit studies.
I object.
<g>

You can put up a new topic every week and will no doubt get responses to it.
You should! Change topics whenever you want. But expecting unschoolers to
stay on topic and drop a topic because we hit the end of the line on the
calendar will be like herding (indoor OR outdoor) cats.

Sandra

messages.subject: NEW TOPIC
messages.msgSnippet: To all, Perhaps we could initiate a TOPIC OF THE WEEK for this list.  Even though the our off topic tangents tend to be quite interesting, a topic of the
messages.messageBody:
To all,
Perhaps we could initiate a TOPIC OF THE WEEK for this list. Even
though the our "off topic" tangents tend to be quite interesting, a
topic of the week might help us stay a little more on track as far as
discussing homeschooling and unschooling issues. Any thoughts?
